Interest: bollywood, bollywood music, bollywood style, bollywood fashion, bollywood life, bollywood news, bollywood gossip, bollywood movie, bollywood movies, bollywood dance
Festivals: ['Aesthetica Short Film Festival', 'Leeds International Film Festival', 'Sydney Film Festival', 'London Korean Film Festival', 'Mezipatra Queer Film Festival', 'Fort Lauderdale International Film Festival', 'Thessaloniki International Film Festival', 'New Orleans Film Festival', 'Cork International Film Festival', 'La Cabina Festival - Festival Internacional de Mediometrajes de València', 'Verzio International Human Rights Documentary Film Festival', 'DOC NYC', 'Málaga Fantastic Film Festival', 'Loft Film Fest', 'Stockholm International Film Festival', 'RIDM - Montreal International Documentary Festival', 'Canberra Short Film Festival', 'Films from the South Festival - Film Fra Sør', 'Alexandria Film Festival', 'Amiens Film Festival', 'Norwich Film Festival', 'This Is England Film Festival', 'Tallinn Black Nights Film Festival', 'A-Film Teens Fest - International Online Children and Youth Film Festival', 'Havana Glasgow Film Festival', 'Festival Cámara Corporizada', 'Derby Film Festival', 'IDFA - International Documentary Festival Amsterdam', 'Jean Rouch International Film Festival']
Narrative:
Ranbir Kapoor is effortless as Shamshera and Balli. Despite his co-stars’ strong performances and author backed roles, he manages to hold his ground throughout the film. Vaani Kapoor shines in every scene that she appears in, while Sanjay Dutt aces as antagonist Daroga Shuddh Singh. The dichotomy in his name vis-a-vis his actions is an interesting addition to the character, and so is his sense of humour that adds to the overall theatrics of the role. 👍🏻👍🏻👍🏻

His actions often make you wonder if there is more to his power hungry character, and maybe a spin off on Daroga Shuddh Singh in the future would be a good idea to explore that aspect of the part. Other supporting cast including, Saurabh Shukla and Ronit Roy play their parts to the T. However, Ronit’s character could have been experimented with a little more, as it gets completely stagnant after a point in the film. 

Overall, Karan Malhotra’s Shamshera starring Ranbir Kapoor, Vaani Kapoor and Sanjay Dutt is in line with the ongoing trend of workable films, and has the right amount of drama, action, romance, humour and all other masala potboiler elements to entertain the audience. 🫡🫡
Title: Ranbir Kapoor, Vaani Kapoor & Sanjay Dutt’s film has all the elements of a masala potboiler🔥🔥
